channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Victorians are bracing for tough, new stage four restrictions as community transmission of COVID-19 continues to be too high.
item.title: As it happened: Victoria imposes stage four restrictions including curfew, 5km lockdown limit; NSW battles clusters, Australian death toll jumps to 208

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Jets keep their finals hopes alive, dent Western's progress to a play-off spot with a narrow win in a tight and entertaining contest in the Hunter Valley.
item.title: Newcastle edge Western 1-0 in tight tussle as both chase finals dream

item.description: Ninja Warrior is an enjoyable concept, smartly executed, that doesn't overstay its welcome.
item.title: What's on TV: Sunday, August 9

item.description: The eighth season of the BBC's period murder mystery starts with a distinct lack of an instigating homicide.
item.title: What's on TV: Saturday, August 8

item.description: This show made best-of lists year after year, delivering a focus on the emotional travails of its character.
item.title: What's on TV: Friday, August 7

item.dc:creator: The Age's View
item.description: Victoria needs the support of the nation. If we fail to suppress the virus, the rest of Australia will struggle to keep it out.
item.title: Victoria's state of disaster is also a national emergency

item.description: More fogging prevention tips for bespectacled mask-wearers, including this septuagenarian.
item.title: Pilloried pollies get a fitting tribute

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Victoria's disease detectives are trying to trace the origin of almost 800 mystery coronavirus cases amid warnings the number will rise.
item.title: Disease detectives baffled by mystery COVID-19 cases behind tough new lockdown

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Collingwood are in trouble. At the end of round nine they're outside of the top eight, and just lost their first of four matches in 14 days across three states, going down by 12 points to Fremantle.
item.title: Magpies under pressure after upset loss to the Dockers

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Scott Morrison says Victoria's declaration of a state of disaster will be felt "well beyond" the state's borders.
item.title: Nation's COVID-19 recovery hinges on Victorians doing their bit, says PM

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The Western Bulldogs have wielded the selection axe, dropping Billy Gowers and Jackson Trengove from the side that was thrashed by Richmond last week.
item.title: Bulldogs pair pay the price for Tiger mauling

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Melbourne Vixens put aside all the pre-season uncertainty to score a win over Collingwood Magpies in their Super Netball return in Brisbane on Sunday night.
item.title: Potent Vixens outlast young Magpies in season opener

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: A trail of happy signs, a virtual holiday photo booth and a giant puzzle wall are among a series of activities taking away the coronavirus blues at a park in Melbourne’s inner west.
item.title: 'We haven't felt isolated': Community spirit lifts as restrictions come down in Yarraville

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Dave Rennie is a day away from freedom, with plenty of work to do, before the Wallabies play New Zealand on October 10.
item.title: 'Genuine intensity' in Super Rugby thriller pleases quarantined Rennie

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The latest COVID-19 restrictions will test the resilience of our society and economy in a way we haven’t experienced before.
item.title: Melbourne staggers into next phase of pandemic

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: A Templestowe couple are among the many brides and grooms forced to call off weddings due to Victoria's harder lockdown.
item.title: Rings at the ready, but COVID-19 ruins couple's wedding plans ... again

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: A deal between the NRL and players' union is yet to be finalised, but the cash cow that comes with appearances for NSW and Queensland is set to end.
item.title: Origin stars to have $30,000-a-game payments scrapped

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: NSW's main irrigator lobby group pressed the Berejiklian government to place the state's water plans above the federal law and sought to tap water earmarked for the environment.
item.title: Irrigators pushed for NSW 'primacy' over basin plan, more water access

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The NSW health system's preparation for an outbreak of deadly SARS virus in 2003 helped it quickly respond to the COVID-19 pandemic. But deficiencies in the aged care sector threaten to fuel a second wave in this state.
item.title: The untold story of how the NSW health system avoided disaster

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: When asked if stage four pandemic restrictions put a line through the AFL decider being held at the MCG, a spokesman for the league replied "no".
item.title: AFL not giving up hope on Victoria hosting the grand final

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The people of Victoria, now confronting a state of disaster, need the support of the entire nation as they endure the darkest days of the pandemic so far.
item.title: It's Victoria's disaster but it's a national emergency

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: AFL life member Jude Bolton has called for the league to consider again allowing a third man up at ruck contests in a bid for clarity on the holding the ball rule.
item.title: 'Unravel the mess': AFL urged to solve holding the ball confusion

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Police have tried for 17 years to find out why Paul Wright vanished without a trace from Rosanna one September day in 2003. He is one of about 2600 long-term missing persons cases across the country.
item.title: Help end the heartache: Plea for answers on mystery disappearances

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The lawyer for the prime suspect in the abduction of the British child says his client will never co-operate with the law.
item.title: Madeleine suspect will never talk to police, says lawyer

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 1, 2020

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Students across Victoria will return to remote learning on Wednesday, with tighter exemptions for children of essential workers than the government imposed last lockdown.
item.title: State's schools, childcare centres to close for most children

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Jake Carlisle has come under fire from former greats for targeting Dane Rampe's injured hand but avoided suspension for an act labelled "not a great look".
item.title: 'Stupid, immature': Carlisle avoids ban for targeting Rampe's hand

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Richmond chief Brendon Gale says Tigers captain has offered to pay the penalty which was dished out to the club after his wife breached AFL restrictions on the Gold Coast.
item.title: Cotchin offers to pay Richmond fine for protocol breach

item.dc:creator: Mathew Dunckley
item.description: With coronavirus case numbers staying stubbornly high, Melbourne is moving to stage four lockdown and regional Victoria to stage three. What exactly are the new restrictions?
item.title: What do Melbourne's stage four and regional Victoria's stage three lockdown restrictions mean for you?

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Traffic cameras showed bumper to bumper southbound traffic heading towards Brisbane throughout Sunday afternoon.
item.title: Bruce Highway traffic easing after 25-kilometre delays

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Victorian businesses are waiting to hear whether they have to close, scale back operations, or have staff work from home, as coronavirus restrictions are tightened.
item.title: Victorian businesses brace for new coronavirus restrictions

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Melbourne United's off-season has been thrown into turmoil after 12 players tested positive to COVID-19, forcing the team to immediately halt training.
item.title: Melbourne United struck by COVID outbreak, 12 players test positive

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Concerning pictures of thousands of punters packing into Sunshine Coast Stadium have prompted the NRL to contact the Storm and the Sunshine Coast Council.
item.title: NRL ask Storm, Sunshine Coast Council for explanation as Smith injures shoulder

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 2, 2020

item.description: Alan Moir, The Sydney Morning Herald's political cartoonist, sketches the political unreality.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Alan Moir

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Some 170 fines were handed out, including to people gathered for a birthday party.
item.title: Police hand out $250,000 in fines in 24 hours to 'appalling' COVID-19 rule breakers

item.description: Follow the action live as the Dockers take on the Pies in Perth.
item.title: Live AFL scores: Fremantle v Collingwood

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: It’s hard to be overlooked when no one can see over you, but ruckmen are off the radar; Substantial Saints; Crows coach looks to break his duck; Bucks stops here.
item.title: 4 Points: The game's best players are hiding in plain sight

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The NRL will probe an after-the-siren play from Parramatta's cult hero which could have given Canterbury a chance to send the game into golden point.
item.title: Golden miss: were the Bulldogs robbed with deliberate Sivo pass?

item.description: The United States, India and South Africa are struggling to rein in their first wave of infections while a number of other countries are trying to avert a second wave.
item.title: India reports 55,000 virus cases, as numbers surge in Japan

item.description: Major League Baseball's sputtering effort to play in a pandemic has taken another discouraging turn.
item.title: Four more coronavirus cases for Cardinals, MLB season in peril

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Melburnians will be confined to their neighbourhoods for at least another six weeks and subject to the city's first-ever curfew, and regional Victoria will move to stage three lockdown.
item.title: State of disaster declared as Victoria records 671 new cases of coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Greater Western Sydney are back in the eight but it has come at a big cost.
item.title: Giants hamstrung: Greene, de Boer hurt in win against Suns

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: NSW Swifts made full use of the controversial Super Shot to kick off the Super Netball season in style with a comeback win against their cross-town rivals.
item.title: Swifts' second-half surge keeps Giants at bay in Sydney derby
